article.title: Lower Mass Bound on the $W^′$ mass via Neutrinoless Double Beta Decay in a 3-3-1 Model

choices: The decay of a W boson into two electrons.
The standard diagram for neutrinoless double beta decay mediated by light massive neutrinos.
The interaction of two neutrinos via a W boson.
The production of a W boson in a proton-proton collision.

multiple_choice_question.text: What information can be extracted from Figure 2?
choices: The half-life of a particular isotope undergoing double beta decay.
Constraints on the effective Majorana neutrino mass from various experiments and projections for future sensitivity.
The mass hierarchy of the three known neutrino flavors.
The energy levels of different isotopes involved in double beta decay.

multiple_choice_question.text: Formula 2.11 describes the mass eigenstates of which particles?
choices: Two neutral gauge bosons present in the model.
The Standard Model W boson and the new charged gauge boson W\'.
Two exotic quarks predicted by the model.
The three scalar triplets introduced for mass generation.

multiple_choice_question.text: According to formula 3.10, what is the main implication of the non-observation of neutrinoless double beta decay for the minimal 3-3-1 model?
choices: It sets an upper bound on the scale of symmetry breaking of the model.
It tightly constrains the mixing angle between the W and W\' bosons.
It leads to a lower mass bound on the W\' boson that can exceed those from collider searches.
It requires the vev of the scalar field σ₁ to be extremely large.
